headline: Revisiting 3 Stock Picks: S&P Global, Boeing, and MSG Sports. Where They Stand Now.
summary: Revisiting former stock picks isn’t just about tallying past performance—old calls can reveal fresh investing opportunities.  This week I revisit S&P Global, a financial data play possibly on the rebound;  Boeing’s  tactical pullback; and entertainment play MSG Sports.  Last month, Barron’s Todd Chanko said to buy S&P Global, the ratings and financial data giant, when it was trading around $528.

headline: How Investors May Respond To S&P Global (SPGI) Expanding Private Markets and AI Benchmark Offerings
summary: In February 2026, S&P Global reported solid quarterly results with revenue growth, wider operating margins and higher earnings per share, while advancing initiatives in private markets, energy and artificial intelligence, alongside new partnerships with Cambridge Associates and Mercer. At the same time, S&P Dow Jones Indices broadened its reach into private credit with new S&P Lincoln Senior Debt Indices, giving investors fresh tools to track direct lending markets in the US and...

headline: 5 industries that have gotten rocked by the AI 'scare trade' defining markets this year
summary: An AI-driven sell-off has spread well beyond software stocks. Here are the industries that have been affected.

headline: Nearly two-thirds of companies have lost track of their data just as they’re letting AI in through the front door to wander around
summary: Thales SVP Sebastien Cano said that when security is weak, "AI can amplify those weaknesses ... far faster than any human ever could."

headline: AI: The New Insider Threat Facing Organizations
summary: MEUDON, France, February 25, 2026--According to the Thales 2026 Data Threat Report, organizations across various markets including automotive, energy, finance and retail say the rapid pace of AI-driven transformation is now their biggest security challenge. Based on the report’s research, conducted by S&P Global 451 Research, 61% cite AI as their top data security risk. The concern is not only about malicious AI, but about the access it is being granted as it shifts from a tool to a trusted insi
